LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-03-06T15:47:45Z Dianne Murray 2015-03-06T15:34:38+00:00 2015-03-06T15:34:38+00:00 Cfp, Extended deadline, ECCE 15 conference https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=TANGIBLE-INTERACTION;f63d856f.1503 (Apologies for any cross posting) Thierry DUTOIT 2015-02-24T10:01:37+00:00 2015-02-24T10:01:37+00:00 CfP : eNTERFACE 2015 summer 1-month workshop on Multimodal Interfaces, Mons, Belgium, August 10th - September 4th https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=TANGIBLE-INTERACTION;be9f1a7c.1502 (sorry for possible multiple postings)<br>Call for Participation<br><br>The NUMEDIART Institute for Creative Technology of University of Mons<http://www.numediart.org/>, Belgium, invites researchers to join eNTERFACE\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd15<http://www.enterface.net/enterface15>, the 11th one-month Summer Workshop on Multimodal Interfaces, to be held in Mons, Belgium, the European Capital of Culture 2015<http://www.mons2015.eu/en>, from August 10th to September 4th, 2015.<br><br>eNTERFACE workshops gather in a single place a team of senior project leaders, researchers, and students, to work on a pre-specified list of challenges<http://www.enterface.net/enterface15/?page_id=77> for 4 weeks. Participants are organized in teams, each team being attached to a specific project. At TEI 2015 ###<br><br>Un-Crafting: Exploring Tangible Practices for Deconstruction in Interactive System Design<br>2-days Studio Workshop at TEI 2015 - January 15th and 16th, 2015, Stanford<br><br>*** Call for Participation ***<br><br>This studio workshop brings together design researchers and practitioners to ***break*** various interactive artifacts.<br><br>With this studio-workshop we aim to explore and debate how disassembling computational things can yield a potential for design practices. We believe there are significant qualities to be found in extending the mundane \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdtaking things apart\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd into an elaborate practice of 'un-crafting'. The studio workshop comprises a series of [...] Jason Alexander 2014-11-12T22:53:27+00:00 2014-11-12T22:53:27+00:00 Call for Participation: TEI '15 Studios and Workshops https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=TANGIBLE-INTERACTION;494fa5bf.1411 ACM TANGIBLE, EMBEDDED, AND EMBODIED INTERACTION (TEI) 2015<br>January 15-19, 2015 Stanford, USA.<br><br>Full details: http://www.tei-conf.org/15/studios-workshops/<br>Registration:<br>https://www.regonline.com/Register/Checkin.aspx?EventID=1611674<br><br>This is a general call for participation in an exciting schedule of<br>studios, workshops, and combined studio-workshops to be held on January<br>15 and 16 at TEI '15. Studios are space limited and offered on a<br>first-come first-served sign-up (so get in fast!); workshops run a<br>standard position-paper submission process. [...] Florian 'Floyd' Mueller 2014-10-21T18:32:23-04:00 2014-10-21T18:32:23-04:00 PhD openings on Digital Play at RMIT University, Melbourne, Australia https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=TANGIBLE-INTERACTION;7d2bd481.1410 PhD openings on at RMIT University, Melbourne, Australia Elizabeth Goodman 2014-10-20T14:10:26-07:00 2014-10-20T14:10:26-07:00 Final CFP: Arts Track for ACM Tangible, Embedded and Embodied Interaction (TEI) 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=TANGIBLE-INTERACTION;11220952.1410 CALL FOR PARTICIPATION: ARTS TRACK<br><br>ACM TANGIBLE, EMBEDDED AND EMBODIED INTERACTION (TEI) 2015<br>January 16-19, 2015 in Palo Alto, California, USA<br>http://tei-conf.org/<br><br>===== SUBMISSION DEADLINES =====<br><br>\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd October 31, 11:59 PST<br><br>===== ABOUT THE ARTS TRACK OF TEI ======<br><br>The work presented at TEI focuses on physical interaction with computing technology and addresses theories, design, user experience, interfaces, interaction, and technical development. It brings together research disciplines, including tangible computing, physical computing, speculative design, IT product design, appliance design, whole body interaction, gestural interaction, embodied<br>interaction, responsive architecture, and responsive and interactive environments and spaces. [...] Leonardo Angelini 2014-10-20T16:34:14+01:00 2014-10-20T16:34:14+01:00 1st Workshop on Tangible Gesture Interaction (TEI\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd15) \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Call for Participation https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=TANGIBLE-INTERACTION;700c511.1410 Tangible Meets Gestural: Comparing and Blending Post-WIMP Interaction Paradigms - First Workshop on Tangible Gesture Interaction \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd TEI 2015, January 15 or 16, Stanford<br><br>*** Call for Papers ***<br>Tangible interaction and gestural interaction are two evolving interaction paradigms that are gaining an increasing interest within the HCI community. In a world where many objects become intelligent, opening the doors to ubiquitous computing, these two interaction paradigms seem particularly promising to exploit two innate human skills: the ability to manipulate objects and the ability to communicate through gestures. Multi-disciplinary by nature, ACE attracts participants interested in going beyond established paradigms in computer science, design, the arts, sociology, anthropology, psychology, and marketing to shape the future of interactive media and entertainment. [...] Bakker, S. 2014-10-08T15:04:17+00:00 2014-10-08T15:04:17+00:00 AMI2014: extended deadline CfC Ambient Gaming Workshop \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd November 11, 2014 Eindhoven https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=TANGIBLE-INTERACTION;df370abc.1410 Call for Contributions: Ambient Gaming Workshop \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd November 11, 2014 Eindhoven<br><br>****Apologies for Cross Posting ****<br><br>extended deadline for submission: 12 October 2014<br>Notification of acceptance: 20 October 2014<br>Workshop: 11 November 2014<br>Web: http://www.playfitproject.nl/ambientgamingworkshop/<br><br>About Ambient Gaming and Play<br><br>The definition of play is often restricted to a specific ‘time and place’. Digital play can be more integrated in a spatial, temporal and social sense owing to new media, social networks, modern technology and (social) interaction. This enables to design for playful activities that are seamlessly integrated within our daily lives in such a way that the boundaries between [...] Dianne Murray 2014-10-01T13:23:25+01:00 2014-10-01T13:23:25+01:00 Latest issues of journal, Interacting with Computers https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=TANGIBLE-INTERACTION;1bd6365d.1410 http://iwc.oxfordjournals.org/content/26/5.toc<br><br>http://iwc.oxfordjournals.org/content/26/6?etoc
